4.44.text: These people are amongst the greatest quiz players in Britain.

10.00.text: Together, they make up the Eggheads,

12.00.text: arguably the most formidable quiz team in the country.

17.32.text: The question is, can they be beaten?

23.96.text: Welcome to Eggheads, the show where a team of five quiz Challengers

27.72.text: pit their wits against possibly the greatest quiz team in Britain.

32.84.text: I say it with conviction cos you're playing so well at the moment.

39.20.text: Taking on the might of our quiz goliaths today

41.60.text: are Quizee McRascal from Glasgow. Now, this friends

45.20.text: and family team regularly quiz together

47.96.text: in The Smiddy in the city's Southside.

51.68.text: Hi. My name is Eamonn, and I'm a retired publican.

54.72.text: Hi. I'm David. I'm a marine engineer.

57.48.text: Hi. I'm Paul. I'm a postgraduate student in translation studies.

61.00.text: Hi. I'm Joe, and I'm a maths teacher.

63.48.text: Hi. I'm Alex, and I'm a PhD student in management science.

67.16.text:
- So, Eamonn, team, welcome. 
- Thank you. 
- Good to see you.

69.80.text: And tell us about The Smiddy. What kind of a place is it?

72.68.text: Oh, it's a very traditional Scottish bar.

74.80.text: We all meet and have a very good time,

76.64.text: and they run a very good quiz.

78.12.text:
- But how good, we'll find out shortly, I think. 
- Oh, indeed.

80.80.text: Now, you're all connected with each other in some mysterious way,

84.20.text: aren't you? Take me through it. Take me through the relationships.

87.08.text:
- David is going out with my daughter. 
- OK.

90.44.text:
- So, he's on best behaviour tonight. 
- Yeah.

92.52.text: And then the rest of the friends here,

94.32.text: they're all part of the quiz team.

96.16.text: That's Paul, Joe, his brother, and Alex, along at the end,

99.32.text: they're all part of The Smiddy quiz team

101.04.text:
- that we all participate in. 
- OK.

102.48.text: The name of the team is a play on Dizzee Rascal...

107.20.text:
- Is that right? 
- Yeah. 
- Is that because you are a fan, Eamonn, of Dizzee?

110.40.text:
- No, the young people chose that one. 
- THEY LAUGH

113.80.text: Now, I mentioned the fact that they were doing very well,

118.16.text: We have, as you know, £1,000 worth of cash

120.24.text: up for grabs for our Challengers each day.

122.16.text: If you fail to defeat the Eggheads,

123.76.text: the prize money rolls over to the next show.

126.00.text: Now, this lot have won the last 22 games.

129.20.text:
- Ooh. 
- So, they're storming it, so you have to stop them.

135.28.text:
- How about that for a challenge? 
- Yeah, up for that.

137.60.text:
- It would be an honour. 
- JEREMY LAUGHS

140.24.text: The first head-to-head battle is on the subject of Science.

143.20.text: Quizee McRascal, which one of you would like to play Science?

146.12.text:
- I think me? 
- The plan was for David to do it. 
- I think that's you.

149.24.text:
- Yeah, so, I'll be doing Science. 
- OK, David.

152.12.text: Trying to impress the potential father-in-law?

154.28.text:
- HE LAUGHS Or am I jumping the gun there? 
- Er...

159.32.text: "No comment" is the official line at the moment.

165.24.text:
- I'm trying to think back to the battle plan that we did. 
- Yeah.

169.52.text:
- Dave, do we think? 
- OK. 
- Do you want to go with David first?

172.84.text:
- David versus Dave? 
- Yeah. 
- Dave versus Dave. 
- Oh, lovely.

176.04.text: OK, so, David from Quizee McRascal chooses our David,

181.04.text: Gentlemen, to avoid any conferring, please go to the Question Room.

186.32.text: So, OK, David the Challenger, Science against the man we call TKD.

191.88.text: Would you like to go first or second?

193.64.text: I'd like to go first, please.

202.20.text: is used to correct irregularities with which organ of the body?

209.92.text: Very good. The heart it is.

214.12.text: of the plumage of the little egret?

220.92.text: Um, I've not really noticed much, but I'm going to go white,

227.44.text: And white is correct. Well done.

244.28.text: I think Barry will know this.

246.12.text:
- URL is Uniform Resource Locator. 
- Uniform Resource Locator.

251.04.text: Sorry, David, it's resource. Back to you, Tremendous Knowledge.

256.08.text: is known as podagra when it affects the feet?

264.04.text: I've not heard of this phrase at all, podagra.

267.08.text: It would be weird if it was gout, I tell you.

272.60.text: I'm going to go cramp, but I've not got an idea, really,

277.72.text: And you have a bit of gout yourself?

279.52.text: Yes, I do, and it's gout, obviously, then.

281.60.text:
- And you haven't googled it or anything?

290.96.text: OK, back to you, David. That's good.

293.84.text: You've completely discombobulated Tremendous Knowledge David.

297.28.text:
- I'm back in the game.

299.96.text: I'm hearing wedding bells. THEY LAUGH

302.72.text:
- Don't give my girlfriend any ideas. 
- THEY LAUGH

319.40.text: Erm, I'm going to say tin.

322.24.text: Really glad you did. You're right. Excellent.

329.08.text: I'm a marine engineer in the Merchant Navy.

331.44.text: So, you've got an eye for that kind of question?

334.16.text: If I'd got that wrong, I wouldn't have been welcome back in the boat,

338.64.text: OK, Dave, this is your question now to stay in.

341.32.text: Which common electronic device typically uses a CCD or CMOS sensor?

355.64.text: ..because you've said electronic rather than electrical...

359.92.text: Could be getting me totally the wrong way.

362.36.text: ..I'm going to go for digital camera.

365.40.text:
- Ooh, that's very smart. Yeah, digital camera it is. 
- Yeah.

404.72.text: Yeah, I see where you're going. Not that.

410.48.text: M-A-R-E. Or you could say "mayree", some people say.

- so that makes me feel better.

1480.56.text:
- It's logical enough. 
- I'd be happy with that.

1485.56.text: Calfskin is the right answer. You are playing well.

1490.16.text: HE CHUCKLES Little shiver of anticipation

1492.96.text: for these Eggheads. They know when there's a good team in the house.

1497.92.text: They see a lot of them. OK, Eggheads, your second question.

1502.96.text:
- You won't get a second chance with this lot. 
- No.

1506.80.text: Which current assay office in the UK has a castle as its hallmark?

1515.24.text:
- Edinburgh, isn't it? 
- Edinburgh. 
- It's Edinburgh.

1519.04.text: and London's got the leopard's head.

1525.36.text: You seemed very certain. The answer is Edinburgh. Well done.

1528.52.text: Two out of two for you as well. Back to our Challengers.

1532.08.text: Which English model, born in 1978, is a keen racing driver

1537.24.text: and also competed at the 2001 Women's World Polo Championships?

1550.40.text: There have been questions about English models before,

1553.48.text: and the date of birth has come up.

1555.76.text: I'm sure Naomi Campbell is older than that.

1558.32.text:
- Yeah, that's what I was thinking. 
- So I don't think it's Naomi Campbell.

1561.52.text:
- My inclination is to go with Agyness Deyn. 
- Yeah.

1564.52.text: But it's not really based on much.

1568.24.text: Do we think that name looks the sort of name

1570.16.text: that's more likely to have competed in a polo world championship?

1573.04.text: I have absolutely no idea. I...

1576.28.text:
- It could be any one of them. 
- Yeah.

1577.96.text: I think that might be logic enough to go on it - the name.

1580.28.text: OK, we don't know this, Jeremy,

1581.84.text: but we're going to go with Agyness Deyn.

1584.40.text: Agyness Deyn is your answer. See if the Eggheads know.

1587.56.text:
- ALL: 
- Jodie Kidd. 
- Jodie Kidd, yeah.

1591.08.text: Well, I said that they mustn't let you in, and you've let them in,

1595.92.text: and this could be over all too quickly

1598.52.text: if the Eggheads get this right.

1600.52.text: So, it's all on the third question now.

1602.84.text: Eggheads, which astronomer wrote the novel entitled Contact,

1606.96.text: later made into a film starring Jodie Foster?

1615.68.text:
- I'm reasonably sure it's Sagan. 
- Yeah, I thought it was Sagan.

1618.60.text:
- I don't know. 
- I don't recall Hubble or Tombaugh

1621.96.text:
- ever having been noted for... 
- Novel writing.

1627.16.text: Whereas Carl Sagan did occasionally turn his hand to fiction.

1631.92.text:
- Yeah, OK. 
- So, go with that, yeah?

1635.24.text: Not 100% certain, but we think the one there

1637.64.text: who occasionally turned his hand to fiction,

1643.84.text: So, we had a Jodie Kidd on this side

1645.52.text: and we had a Jodie Foster on that side.

1647.72.text: It's been pretty evenly matched, this amazing contest. Is it over?

1651.60.text: The novel entitled Contact was indeed written by Carl Sagan.

1655.92.text: We say congratulations, Eggheads. You have won.

1663.88.text: Yeah, you started awkwardly, and then really powered through them

1667.72.text: and they just held you off at the end there.

1670.12.text:
- Yeah. 
- Oh, Jodie Kidd. Don't ever look at a photo of her.

1674.36.text:
- We didn't know it, so I don't think we can really... 
- No complaints.

1677.48.text:
- Difficult to guess from nothing, yeah. 
- Yeah.

1680.00.text: Thank you so much for playing.

1681.36.text: Commiserations as well to Quizee McRascal.

1685.00.text: The Eggheads have done what is coming

1686.80.text: increasingly naturally to them, but I won't use the word effortless.

1690.20.text:
- Certainly not today. 
- No, not at all. 
- The winning streak continues.

1693.40.text: It does mean you won't be going home with the £23,000,

1696.80.text: so the money now rolls over to our next show.

1699.72.text: Join us next time to see if a new team of Challengers

1702.28.text: can win the money and defeat them.

1704.08.text: £24,000 says they can't. Till then, goodbye.
